post_text:
Dear CCSU families,

We recognize the disruption to education caused by the weather over the past few weeks. Tomorrow's forecast once again includes a threat of ice, further complicated by a planned staff professional development day. Obviously, there is little educational value to a potential late start and early dismissal combined in one day, and we don't want to risk unnecessary cancellation.

In light of the potential weather tomorrow, all CCSU schools will plan to have a full day of school on Friday, February 8th, and will cancel our plans for an early dismissal. We understand families may have already made other afternoon plans, and will certainly excuse your child if that is the case.

While we hope we won't have to delay tomorrow, we will make that call tomorrow morning following our usual procedures.

Thank you for your patience as we work to manage this winter's very challenging and unpredictable weather in the best way possible!

Dear Walden Families,

Due to the worsening weather conditions, all schools in Caledonia Central Supervisory Union will be dismissing students at 1PM. There will also be no after school programs, activities, or sporting events. Please call the office with any changes to your child's dismissal plan for today. This includes Waterford, Danville, Peacham, Barnet, and Walden schools.

We recognize the extreme inconvenience unplanned early releases cause to families, and make every attempt to avoid them. We appreciate your patience and understanding today.

post_text:
Dear Parents, Caregivers and Community Members,
We have recently become aware of a dangerous game called the Pass Out Game, Blackout Game or the Choking Game. The game has several forms, the one that has surfaced locally is the most dangerous form. In short, one person chokes another person until the individual passes out. The game is popular because bystanders enjoy watching the victim fall and victims volunteer because the experience produces a temporary high. Please talk to your children about the dangers of this game-including physical injury, lasting mental injury, and in some cases death. Signs that individuals have participated in this game include bruising or marks around the neck, bloodshot eyes, headaches, and disorientation. We care deeply about your children and want to make sure you have information that might assist you in preventing children from participating in this activity.
Sincerely,
Dr. Mathew G. Forest
Superintendent, CCSU
text:
Dear Parents, Caregivers and Community Members,
We have recently become aware of a dangerous game called the Pass Out Game, Blackout Game or the Choking Game. The game has several forms, the one that has surfaced locally is the most dangerous form. In short, one person chokes another person until the individual passes out. The game is popular because bystanders enjoy watching the victim fall and victims volunteer because the experience produces a temporary high. Please talk to your children about the dangers of this game-including physical injury, lasting mental injury, and in some cases death. Signs that individuals have participated in this game include bruising or marks around the neck, bloodshot eyes, headaches, and disorientation. We care deeply about your children and want to make sure you have information that might assist you in preventing children from participating in this activity.
Sincerely,
Dr. Mathew G. Forest
Superintendent, CCSU

post_text:
Notice to community members of Barnet, Waterford, and Walden interested in running for the office of School Director for the newly forming Caledonia Cooperative Unified Union School District Board of School Directors effective July 1, 2018 for:
a 1 year term that expires in March of 2019 or,
a 2 year term that expires in March of 2020 or,
a 3 year term that expires in March of 2021
at the election to be held on May 23, 2017.

Petitions are available at the town clerk's office, need 30 signatures or 1% of registered voters, whichever is less. Signed petitions are due to the town clerk by April 24, 2017.
text:
Notice to community members of Barnet, Waterford, and Walden interested in running for the office of School Director for the newly forming Caledonia Cooperative Unified Union School District Board of School Directors effective July 1, 2018 for:
a 1 year term that expires in March of 2019 or,
a 2 year term that expires in March of 2020 or,
a 3 year term that expires in March of 2021
at the election to be held on May 23, 2017.

Petitions are available at the town clerk's office, need 30 signatures or 1% of registered voters, whichever is less. Signed petitions are due to the town clerk by April 24, 2017.
